1.title: Roadie to Nowhere/A Fridge Too Far
1.plot: After learning that Chunk was like her in high school, Luna worries her ambition to be a rocker is unrealistic. When food Lincoln has saved in the fridge gets taken, a territory war in the fridge ensues.

2.title: Selfie Improvement/No Place Like Homeschool
2.plot: Lori competes in a selfie war with a popular rival. The Loud kids try to get off school easy and tag along Lola's homeschooling.

3.title: White Hare/Insta-gran
3.plot: Lincoln has plans for introducing him to a new girl, but it turns for the worse when his sisters find out Albert, Lincoln's grandfather has met a new girlfriend.

4.title: City Slickers/Fool Me Twice
4.plot: Lori and Lincoln visit the city. Lori struggles to be a city girl and Lincoln finds Ronnie Anne has changed. The family has a new plan to dodge Luan's April Fool's Day pranking: stunt doubles.

5.title: Net Gains/Pipe Dreams
5.plot: Lynn desperately wants to win a basketball championship, but gets drafted onto a terrible team.

6.title: Fandom Pains/Rita Her Rights
6.plot: Lucy becomes annoyed when Lori and Leni start watching her vampire show because of a cute new character.

8.title: Teachers' Union/Head Poet's Anxiety
8.plot: To try and make gym class better, Lincoln and Clyde set Coach Pacowski and Mrs. Johnson up. Luan teaches Lucy how to manage the ups and downs of pursuing a life in the arts.

9.title: The Mad Scientist/Missed Connection
9.plot: Lisa gets invited to work at an institute and get away from her crazy family. Lori and Bobby worry that dating long-distance is causing them to lose their connection.

10.title: Deal Me Out/Friendzy
10.plot: Lincoln and Clyde worry that they may be too old to still be playing Ace Savvy. Lincoln loves the privileges of having a friend and starts taking advantage of them.

11.title: Tripped!
11.plot: Everyone in the family has worked hard to save for family vacations. But as they drive to their destination, almost everything goes wrong that can go wrong for the family.

12.title: Pasture Bedtime/Shop Girl
12.plot: The boys struggle with whether to attend Liam's barn sleepover or Girl Jordan's awesome pool party. The kids worry that Leni is too weak and try to teach her how to be more aggressive.

13.title: Ruthless People/What Wood Lincoln Do?
13.plot: When the house is infected with termites, half the family stay with Pop Pop and the others stay with Aunt Ruth. Lincoln has to complete a woodworking assignment, but has a history of failure on the topic.

14.title: Scales of Justice/Crimes of Fashion
14.plot: Lana springs into action when she learns her favorite fish are in jeopardy of losing their home to construction. When Leni gets fired from her job due to missing scarves, Lincoln and Clyde take on the case as Ace and Jack.

16.title: Gown and Out/Breaking Dad
16.plot: When Lola advances to a regional pageant, she worries she could lose for the first time. Dad has Mr. Grouse watch Lily while he goes to a concert, but things quickly start to go wrong.

17.title: Absent Minded/Be Stella My Heart
17.plot: Clyde discovers he didn't earn his junior administrator job, but can't give up the perks that come along with it. When the new girl starts hanging around Lincoln and his friends, they begin to suspect she likes one of them.

18.title: House of Lies/Game Boys
18.plot: After witnessing an excess of lying in the family, Lisa invents lie-detecting glasses to try and curb the fibs. Lincoln asks to borrow Clyde's new gaming system, but Clyde struggles to trust it's safe with him.

19.title: Sitting Bull/The Spies Who Love Me
19.plot: The older sisters reluctantly let Lynn into their babysitting club but she quickly proves to be too aggressive. Ronnie Anne wants to go downtown, but her grandparents think it's too dangerous, so they decide to spy on her.

20.title: Everybody Loves Leni/Middle Men
20.plot: Torn between her work friends and her school friends, Leni tries to bring everyone together. When Lincoln and Clyde go to tour the middle school, Lynn gives them some questionable advice.

21.title: Jeers for Fears/Tea Tale Heart
21.plot: After agreeing to go to The Royal Woods House of Terror, Lincoln and Clyde have to toughen up and face their fears. Lola discovers Lucy has an old, fragile doll, and decides she must borrow it - no matter what Lucy says.

22.title: The Loudest Thanksgiving
22.plot: Faced with spending Thanksgiving apart, Lori and Bobby try to bring their crazy families together for the first time.

23.title: Really Loud Music
23.plot: Hoping to win a song-writing contest, Luna contemplates whether she should go with a song that's true to her sound or try to make something that the whole world will love.

24.title: Predict Ability/Driving Ambition
24.plot: Lincoln finds out he has rituals, but he worries he's predictable so he vows to change it up. When Lori finds out that the golf coach from her dream college is coming to see her play, she develops the yips.

25.title: Home of the Fave/Hero Today, Gone Tomorrow
25.plot: After a pun filled trip to the grocery store with Luan and Lola, Dad worries Lola thinks he plays favorites. When Lynn's friend Margo is celebrated for a one in a million soccer goal, Lynn has to try and be supportive.

26.title: The Write Stuff/Racing Hearts
26.plot: When Lucy quits the writing club at school due to the by the books way Huggins runs the club, Mom takes over. When Luna and Sam embark on a scavenger hunt across Royal Woods, they discover they have vastly different styles.

27.title: Stage Plight/Antiqued Off
27.plot: Hoping to get closer to her crush, Benny, Luan tries out for the school play. When Clyde and schoolmate Zach begin bonding over a mutual interest in antiques, Lincoln quickly finds himself feeling like a third wheel.

28.title: Cooked!
28.plot: The kids promise to help Dad with the grand opening of his new restaurant by coming up with promotions. But their lack of teamwork and crazy promos lead to an ultimate nightmare in the kitchen for Dad.

1.title: Left in the Dark/Get the Message
1.plot: Lincoln is about to watch his favorite TV show when the power goes out. When Lincoln accidentally leaves a critical voicemail on Lori's phone, he must delete it before she finds out.

2.title: Heavy Meddle/Making the Case
2.plot: Lincoln becomes fed up with his siblings constantly meddling in his business. / Lincoln films his sisters in an attempt to win a video contest.

3.title: Along Came a Sister/Chore and Peace
3.plot: Lincoln must care for the class tarantula. / Lincoln goes on strike until someone swaps chores with him.

4.title: Project Loud House/In Tents Debate
4.plot: The girls get in Lincoln's way when he tries to get to school on time. / The Loud family cannot decide on a vacation destination.

5.title: The Sweet Spot/A Tale of Two Tables
5.plot: Lincoln tries to prove that he's mature enough to sit at the grown-up table./Lincoln comes up with a plan to claim the best seat in the family van for a long road trip.

6.title: Driving Miss Hazy/No Guts, No Glori
6.plot: Lincoln tries to help Leni pass her driving test. / Lincoln and his sisters plot an uprising against Lori.

7.title: Picture Perfect/Undie Pressure
7.plot: Lincoln tries to take the perfect family photo. / The Louds try to see who can go the longest without displaying their most annoying quirks.

8.title: Linc or Swim/Changing the Baby
8.plot: Lincoln's sisters all want to use his new kiddie pool. / Lincoln tries to make Lily act just like him.

9.title: Sound of Silence/Space Invader
9.plot: Lincoln buys a pair sound-canceling ear buds to drown out the sound of his sisters. After Lynn and Lucy get in a fight, Lincoln agrees to let Lynn bunk in his room but only for a night!

10.title: Hand-Me-Downer/Sleuth or Consequences
10.plot: After Lincoln gets a pink hand-me-down bike from Lori, he borrows Lynn's cool BMX bike without telling her. Someone clogged the Loud House toilet and Lincoln sets out to find out whodunit.

11.title: For Bros About to Rock/It's a Loud, Loud, Loud, Loud House
11.plot: Lincoln will be going to his first ever rock concert and Luna wants it to be his best experience ever in his life; Lincoln finds a letter to in the attic.

12.title: Overnight Success/Ties That Bind
12.plot: Clyde and Lincoln's sleepover does not go as planned. / A misunderstanding leads to Lincoln believing his parents are getting rid of him and his sisters.

13.title: Butterfly Effect/The Green House
13.plot: Lisa's potions cause an unexpected chain of events that leads to trouble for the Louds. / Lincoln tries to get his sisters to save electricity.

14.title: House Music/A Novel Idea
14.plot: Lincoln enters his sisters into a Talent show and they all decide on becoming a band. Lincoln visits his mother's workplace on "Take your daughter to work day".

15.title: Toads and Tiaras/Two Boys and a Baby
15.plot: When Lola hurts herself and can't compete in her next pageant, Lincoln must train Lana to take her place instead./Lincoln and Clyde take up the task of babysitting Lily, but realize that the job's more difficult than they thought.

16.title: Cover Girls/Save the Date
16.plot: Lincoln has his hands full when all ten of sisters ask him to cover for them at the same time./Lincoln and Lori go on a double date with Bobby and his little sister, Ronnie Anne.

17.title: Attention Deficit/Out on a Limo
17.plot: Lincoln spends more time at Clyde's house when his dad's give more attention than what he usually gets at home.Lincoln's personality changes after he wins a free ride in a limo.

18.title: April Fools Rules/Cereal Offender
18.plot: Lincoln plans to avoid getting pranked by Luan on April Fool's Day this year, but must set off all of Luan's traps around the house before Ronnie Anne arrives. The Loud family goes to the supermarket, but Lincoln has other plans.

19.title: Lincoln Loud Girl Guru/Come Sale Away
19.plot: Lincoln is worried that he's lost his manliness from growing up with all sisters, so he and Clyde go camping. Lincoln gets Lori a job at a pizza arcade, but when he starts to ask favors of her, Lori gets in hot water.

20.title: Roughin' It/The Waiting Game
20.plot: Lincoln is worried that he's lost his manliness from growing up with all sisters, so he and Clyde go camping. Lincoln gets Lori a job at a pizza arcade, but when he starts to ask favors of her, Lori gets in hot water.

21.title: The Loudest Yard/Raw Deal
21.plot: Lincoln Wants Lynn to take his place on his school football team so he doesn't have to play in it./Lincoln Becomes a Hypochondriac after Lucy reads him a fortune, saying that his day will end in disaster.

22.title: Dance Dance Resolution/A Fair to Remember
22.plot: Lincoln avoids Ronnie Anne on Sadie Hawkins dance night, which causes his sisters to accidentally get him four dates./When Lincoln and Bobby become close friends, Lori tries to make Bobby jealous by hanging out with Clyde.

23.title: One of the Boys/A Tattler's Tale
23.plot: Lincoln wishes he had ten brothers instead of ten sisters, and Lisa gives him a glimpse into that reality. Lola wants to be a part of the siblings' secrets club, but they won't let her in because she's a "tattle tale."

24.title: Funny Business/Snow Bored
24.plot: Lincoln becomes Luan's clown assistant, but starts hogging the spotlight. The Loud kids have fun on a snow day while trying to teach Lisa some fun in the snow.

25.title: The Price of Admission/One Flu Over the Loud House
25.plot: After seeing a scary movie (that his parents told him not to), Lincoln can't go to sleep and pulls an all-nighter. When a common cold ravages through the loud house, Lincoln believes his sisters have turned into Zombies!

26.title: Study Muffin/Homespun
26.plot: Lincoln gets a tutor that all his sisters instantly get crushes on, making it impossible for Lincoln to study. The kids complain about their house, but when a tornado threatens to destroy it, they start to feel differently.

1.title: Intern for the Worse/The Old and the Restless
1.plot: Tensions run high when Lincoln and Clyde both get an internship at Flip's and compete to win the manager title. When Lincoln sees how tame Pop-Pop has gotten in his older age, he takes him out for a day to remember.

2.title: 11 Louds A Leapin'
2.plot: The Louds are getting ready for Christmas, when the unthinkable happens to Lincoln; his sled goes in their neighbor's yard! Lincoln and Clyde attempt to pull off a sled rescue mission, and end up finding secrets about Mr. Grouse.

3.title: Baby Steps/Brawl in the Family
3.plot: Clyde thinks Howard and Harold are planning to adopt another child, so Lincoln teaches him how to be a good brother. When Lori and Leni buy the same dress, a fight breaks out leading to DEFCON 5 in the Loud House.

4.title: Suite and Sour/Back in Black
4.plot: The Loud parents take their kids to a spa resort, but they end up causing trouble there. When Lucy develops a crush on a normal boy, her sisters help give her a makeover to win him over.

5.title: Lock 'N' Loud/The Whole Picture
5.plot: When Dad gets upset with the children for never locking the front door, they decide to take home security to the next level, and the kids end up overdoing it. Lincoln accidentally erases all of his old childhood photos, so he and Clyde try to recreate them before Lincoln loses his memories.

6.title: Making the Grade/Vantastic Voyage
6.plot: When Lisa gets put into Lincoln and Clyde's fifth-grade class, Lincoln's social standing is at stake./The Loud kids are sick of their family van always falling apart, so they decide to try and trick their parents into buying a new one.

7.title: No Such Luck/Frog Wild
7.plot: Lincoln is rejected by his sisters because he is "bad luck"; Lincoln and Lana protect the frogs from being dissected.

8.title: Patching Things Up/Cheater by the Dozen
8.plot: Lana and Lola try out for Bluebell Scouts, but soon discover that one of them may be more suited for it than the other. Lincoln and Clyde think that Bobby is cheating on Lori, so they conduct an investigation.

9.title: Kick the Bucket List/Party Down
9.plot: Lincoln and Clyde's plans to spend the spring holiday are turned upside-down when they have only one day to complete all the activities on their activities list. Lori manages to successfully throw a party, but all of her invited guests are unable to come due to their plans.

10.title: Fed Up/Shell Shock
10.plot: Bored with monotonous meals, the kids sabotage dinner to get pizza, but they are caught, and therefore, forced to prepare the food for the family. Lincoln and Ronnie Anne have to deal with an egg at school, but Lincoln does not trust the chaotic Ronnie Anne to take care of the fragile egg.

11.title: Pulp Friction/Pets Peeved
11.plot: Lincoln and Clyde submit an Ace Savvy comic to a meet-the-creator contest, but are foiled by a surprising nemesis. Lana brings a new pet home, which the kids generously overload with attention. This causes the other pets to plan to get rid of it.

12.title: Out of the Picture/Room with a Feud
12.plot: Afraid they'll be forgotten, Lincoln and Clyde want to make a splash in the yearbook and crash group photos. Seeing his sisters fight with their roommates, Lincoln suggests a room shuffle based on a compatibility test.

13.title: Back Out There/Spell It Out
13.plot: Clyde worries that Lincoln is hung up on Ronnie Anne, so he decides to try and cure his post-breakup blues. Tired of her siblings walking all over her, Lucy turns to a spell book once owned by Great Grandma Harriet to teach them a lesson.

14.title: The Loudest Mission: Relative Chaos
14.plot: Ronnie Anne and Bobby visit their crazy, chaotic extended family. Bobby fits in great but Ronnie Anne struggles with the smothering nature of their relatives. Little do they know, their mother has a secret motive.

15.title: Potty Mouth/L Is for Love
15.plot: When the kids hear Lily curse, they're worried they have been a bad influence on her. A love letter addressed to "L" Loud shows up at the house and the family has to figure out who it was meant for.

16.title: Fool's Paradise/Job Insecurity
16.plot: With prankster Luan away at camp for April Fool's Day, the Louds think they should be safe. The kids discover Dad isn't at his old job anymore and worry it might be their fault.

17.title: ARGGH! You for Real?/Garage Banned
17.plot: Lincoln and Clyde find out that ARGGH! is coming to town and decide to go to the taping. Tired of her siblings, Lori moves to the garage, but quickly finds it's more than she bargained for.

18.title: Change of Heart/Health Kicked
18.plot: Clyde, desperate to learn how to act normal around Lori, enlists Leni's help. Worried that Mom and Dad are hurting their health from not being active, the kids encourage them to exercise.

19.title: Future Tense/Lynner Takes All
19.plot: When Mom and Dad meet an impressive family they worry their kids aren't doing enough to ensure successful futures. Tired of Lynn's poor sportsmanship during board games, the siblings decide to team up to take her down.

20.title: Yes Man/Friend or Faux?
20.plot: The sisters enlist the "Master of Convincing" (AKA Lincoln) to teach them how to ask Mom and Dad for money. Lisa gets her report card and finds she's failed "social skills". To bring up her grade, she must make a friend.

21.title: No Laughing Matter/No Spoilers
21.plot: Luan decides to give up her comedy after her siblings complain about it. Since Leni often spoils surprises, her siblings decide not to tell her about their mom's upcoming party.

22.title: Tricked!
22.plot: For Halloween, Lincoln and Clyde have scoped out a fancy neighborhood to make their dreams of scoring full-size candy bars a reality. Meanwhile, Lucy puts on a haunted maze, and the younger girls scheme to get maximum candy.

23.title: Read Aloud/Not a Loud
23.plot: Lola refuses to participate in a reading challenge at the town library./When Lincoln finds the first page in his baby book blank, he suspects that his parents are hiding something from him.

24.title: Legends/Mall of Duty
24.plot: Lincoln and Lynn Sr. compete in "Legends of the Hidden Temple."/ Lincoln has to take his younger sisters to the mall with him.

25.title: The Crying Dame/Anti Social
25.plot: Lincoln and his sisters give Fenton to Lily to make her stop crying, but all it does is annoy them when she keeps pressing his button. After Lynn Sr. threatens to get rid of the internet, Lincoln and his sisters try to introduce him to technology, but they go too far.

26.title: Snow Way Down/Snow Way Out
26.plot: Clyde realizes how overprotective his parents are when they take him and Lincoln on vacation. Despite the heavy snowfall, Lana convinces her siblings to take her to the Burpin' Burger restaurant to do a contest held by her racing hero.

locations: Nickelodeon Animation Studio - 231 W Olive Avenue, Burbank, California, USA
imdb.plot outline: Things are crowded in the Loud household, with 11 children -- 10 girls and one boy -- causing craziness in the house. As the only boy, 11-year-old Lincoln is in the middle of all of the chaos. Whether his sisters are giving him unwanted makeovers or he's racing them to the couch to gain control of the TV, Lincoln is often getting involved in antics with his siblings. Lincoln's best friend Clyde, who happens to be an only child, is jealous of Lincoln's large family and is always willing to play his part in the schemes. Clyde has a crush on Lori, Lincoln's oldest sister and self-proclaimed boss, who is dating Bobby, who holds many jobs -- including lifeguard and mall security guard -- even though he's not very smart.
imdb.title: The Loud House
plot: Lincoln Loud is an eleven-year-old boy who lives with ten sisters. With the help of his right-hand man Clyde, Lincoln finds new ways to survive in such a large family every day.

Things are crowded in the Loud household, with 11 children -- 10 girls and one boy -- causing craziness in the house. As the only boy, 11-year-old Lincoln is in the middle of all of the chaos. Whether his sisters are giving him unwanted makeovers or he's racing them to the couch to gain control of the TV, Lincoln is often getting involved in antics with his siblings. Lincoln's best friend Clyde, who happens to be an only child, is jealous of Lincoln's large family and is always willing to play his part in the schemes. Clyde has a crush on Lori, Lincoln's oldest sister and self-proclaimed boss, who is dating Bobby, who holds many jobs -- including lifeguard and mall security guard -- even though he's not very smart.::Jwelch5742

In the fictional town of Royal Woods, Michigan, Lincoln Loud is the only boy and middle child in a family of eleven children. He has ten sisters with distinctive personalities: bossy eldest child Lori; ditzy fashionista Leni; musician Luna; comedian Luan; athletic Lynn; gloomy goth Lucy; polar-opposite twins Lola and Lana; child genius Lisa, and baby Lily. Lincoln often encounters problems as a result of his large amount of family members, which his best friend Clyde helps him solve. Clyde spends much of his time at the Loud House and communicates with Lincoln via a walkie-talkie when he is not around. Lincoln normally explains his issues to the audience by breaking the fourth wall and speaking to the viewers. While most of Lincoln's plans to make his life easier backfire, his predicaments tend to bring the family closer together.::Dynasti Noble
